messages.content: What is the purpose of the Alpha Clean node?
The Alpha Clean node is designed to remove holes and near-solid areas in a matte, helping to clean up the matte for more accurate image compositing.
What does the Alpha Matte node do?

The Alpha Matte node takes an image and an alpha or trimap and refines the edges with closed-form matting. It can optionally extract the foreground and background colors as well, which is useful for cleaning up SAM segments or hand-drawn masks.
How does the Blur Image (Fast) node work?
The Blur Image (Fast) node uses the opencv gaussian blur algorithm, which is significantly faster than the comfy image blur. It supports larger blur radius and separate x/y controls.
What is the function of the Dilate/Erode Mask node?
The Dilate/Erode Mask node dilates or erodes masks, using either a box or circle filter, which can be useful for expanding or contracting the mask region.
How does the Enhance Detail node improve image quality?

The Enhance Detail node increases or decreases details in an image or batch of images using a guided filter, as opposed to the typical gaussian blur used by most sharpening filters, providing a more natural enhancement of image details.
What is the purpose of the Remap Range node?
The Remap Range node fits the color range of an image to a new blackpoint and whitepoint, useful for clamping or thresholding soft mattes.
How does the Batch Normalize Latent/Image node function?
The Batch Normalize Latent/Image node normalizes each frame in a batch to the overall mean and std dev, helping to remove overall brightness flickering.
What does the Tonemap / UnTonemap node apply or remove?
The Tonemap / UnTonemap node applies or removes a log + contrast curve tonemap, which can be used for adjusting the contrast and dynamic range of images.
What is the purpose of the Exposure Adjust node?
The Exposure Adjust node is a linear exposure adjustment in f-stops, with an optional tonemap, which can be used to brighten or darken the image based on the desired creative effect.
What can the Convert Normals node translate between?
The Convert Normals node can translate between different normal map color spaces, with optional normalization fix and black region fix, which can be useful in 3D rendering workflows.
